definition: small barbarian kingdom in southern China during the Han dynasty
night
variant of 夜[ye4]
surname Lang
(arch.) minister/official/noun prefix denoting function or status/a youth
lit. Yelang thinks highly of itself (idiom)/fig. foolish conceit

sentences.english: Arrogant and adopted into the facts.
The biggest mistake you can make is arrogantly assuming you know it all.
sentences.chinese: 你夜郎自大的傲慢态度是最大的错误。

sentences.english: The ancient Yelang Country is produced in the karst environment.
sentences.chinese: 古夜郎国植根于喀斯特环境。

sentences.english: This is one kind is similar to the parochial arrogance ignorant under absurd illusion.
sentences.chinese: 这是一种类似于夜郎自大的无知下的荒唐幻觉。

the state of Chu, one of the most important of the small states contending for power in China between 770 and 223 BC, located around present-day Hubei
ancient country
